description.narrative: Partnership for citizen engagement (PACE) in Lao. PACE is Oxfam’s flagship active citizenship project in Laos, (EU funded, ONL is PA). PACE aims to strengthen the role and capacity of Lao Civil Society Organizations to promote and protect the rights of Lao citizens through policy dialogue and accountability processes at local and national level. PACE also builds the capacity of Lao People’s Provincial Assemblies to keep oversight of government agencies, programs, activities, policies and laws implemented at constituency level. The project includes small grants mechanism for funding to CSOs and youth volunteers to support policy dialogue and grassrootscooperation. PACE commenced in July 2017 and ends in December 2021. The project is in 9 (out of 18) provinces in Laos. We have madegreat impact and EU is highly supportive of the project – as it is a unique project in supporting citizens’ voices and expanding the civic space in Laos. However, COVID-19 lockdowns in 2020 and 2021 affected some CSOs to complete their activities. Whilst EUD in Laos supported a request for a short no-cost extension until April 2022 (to allow partners to complete their activities), the higher EU strict rules on the length of project time has not allowed for this. In agreementwith EU, Oxfam in Laos is repurposing the CSO grant underspend and Oxfam will fully execute the PACE funding by December 2021. However, we are mindful that for CSO grants not fullycompleted (due to COVID restrictions), important activities that citizensand PPA agreed on will not be completed. At the same time,we have several partners in PACE who have completed or will complete their activities by October/November 2021. We propose to have some top-up from this project to continue supporting these CSOs and youth groups can extend and expand their activities funded underPACE until March 2022.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam in Laos is registered under the legal personality of Oxfam in Belgium and is national country office for Oxfam international.Oxfam in Laos PDR is responsible for the implementation of the Sowing Diversity Harvesting = Security program in close coordinationwith national organizations including the National Agriculture and Forestry Research Institute (NAFRI), the Department of Agriculture (DOA), Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry (MAF) and Lao Farmers Network (LFN). Oxfam Belgium is one of 17 Affiliates that are part of the Oxfam Confederation. As part of this confederation, Oxfam Belgium shared the common vision of a just world without poverty. A world where people are valued and treated equally, enjoy their rightsas full citizens, and can influence decisions affecting their lives.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
